seo.title: Personal Belongings Shipping Germany to Italy | Intrelo
seo.description: Moving from Germany to Italy via the Alps in 3–5 days. Delivery to Sicily & Sardinia. Professional packing, insurance, door-to-door.

og.title: Moving from Germany to Italy — 3–5 Days via Alps
og.description: Direct road transport via Brenner Pass. Door-to-door, including Sicily & Sardinia.

lsi_keywords: moving to italy from germany cost

hero.subtitle: We were the official carrier of the Queen of Britain. Direct road transport via the Alps in 3–5 days. Brenner or Gotthard pass. No customs within the EU. Delivery to islands — Sicily, Sardinia by road + ferry.

process.title: How your move to Italy works
process.subtitle: Both countries are EU members — no customs. Direct route via Brenner or Gotthard pass, 3–5 days door to door.

items.text: Consultation — photos/video via WhatsApp. Free on-site survey anywhere in Germany.
Alpine-grade packing — anti-vibration for mountain passes, extra protection for switchbacks and steep gradients.
Consolidation warehouse — palletising, labelling, groupage option for smaller volumes.
No customs within the EU — free movement. CMR and transport documents only.
Route via Brenner (Munich → Verona, 4 hrs) or Gotthard (Stuttgart → Milan, 5 hrs). We choose the best option.
No reloading on mainland routes. Direct delivery by a single vehicle.
Anywhere in Italy — Rome, Milan, Florence, Naples, Venice, Palermo, Cagliari.
Italian building expertise — narrow staircases, no lifts, historic centre restrictions. External hoist available.
Unpacking, furniture assembly, placement. Packaging removal included.

cargo.title: What we ship from Germany to Italy
cargo.subtitle: Any personal belongings with Alpine-grade packing and vibration protection

services.title: Our services: Germany → Italy

cards.title: Door-to-door via the Alps
cards.text: Full move from any city in Germany to any city in Italy. 3–5 days via Brenner or Gotthard. No customs.

cards.title: Document support
cards.text: CMR, inventory list, insurance papers. Guidance on Italian codice fiscale and residenza.

cards.title: Alpine-grade packing
cards.text: Anti-vibration for switchbacks. Extra securing for mountain road dynamics. Tailored for Italian narrow stairs.

cards.title: Cargo insurance
cards.text: Full coverage door to door within the EU. Single direct route — minimal risk.

cards.title: Storage
cards.text: Warehouses in Germany and Italy. Climate-controlled for art and wine.

cards.title: Specialty items
cards.text: Antiques, art, wine collections. Museum-grade crating. Italian import certificates where needed.

advantages.title: Why choose us for moving to Italy
advantages.subtitle: Alpine logistics experts with deep knowledge of Italian building specifics

cards.title: Alpine route expertise
cards.text: Brenner or Gotthard — we choose the optimal pass. Experienced drivers, mountain-rated vehicles, anti-vibration loading.

cards.title: 3–5 days door to door
cards.text: Munich → Milan: 5 hours. Frankfurt → Rome: 10 hours. Direct delivery, no interim storage.

cards.title: No customs within the EU
cards.text: Germany and Italy are EU members. No duties, no declarations. Transport documents only.

cards.title: We know Italian buildings
cards.text: Narrow staircases, no lifts in historic centres, ZTL zones, parking permits. External hoist for upper floors.

cards.title: Island delivery
cards.text: Sicily and Sardinia — road to mainland port + ferry. Door delivery on the island.

cards.title: GPS tracking
cards.text: Real-time tracking across the Alpine route. Updates at every stage.

packing.title: Professional packing for your move to Italy
packing.subtitle: Alpine passes create vibration and g-forces. Our packing accounts for mountain road dynamics and Italian narrow-stair delivery.

items.text: Acid-free paper for delicate items
Multi-layer bubble wrap — extra for Alpine vibration
PE foam for corners and fragile elements
Reinforced corrugated boxes — secured for mountain switchbacks
Wardrobe boxes with hanging rails
Plywood crates for antiques and fragile items
Anti-vibration mats under heavy items — absorb mountain road dynamics
Internal strapping and bracing — prevents shifting on steep gradients
Climate wrapping for temperature swings (Alpine cold → Mediterranean warmth)
Garment bags for suits and delicate items
Vacuum bags for winter clothing
Individual shoe packing
Anti-static film for laptops and monitors
Original boxes or custom crating with foam inserts
Vibration dampers for mountain transit
Multi-layer dish packing with cell dividers
Telescopic picture boxes with Alpine shock absorption
Custom foam inserts for figurines and décor

transport.title: Shipping methods: Germany to Italy
transport.subtitle: Via the Alps — Brenner or Gotthard. Road is the primary method. Sea for large volumes and islands.

items.text: Hamburg → Genoa / Livorno — 20 ft FCL
40 ft container — full house
Consolidated sea — from 1 m³
Sprinter via Brenner — 3–5 days
Euro truck — full house, 3–5 days
Consolidated road — weekly departures
Frankfurt → Rome/Milan — 1–2 days
Urgent document delivery
Consolidated air — from 30 kg
Road + ferry via Villa San Giovanni (Sicily)
Road + ferry via Livorno/Civitavecchia (Sardinia)
Direct sea container to Palermo/Cagliari

pricing.title: Shipping comparison: Germany → Italy
pricing.subtitle: Within the EU — no customs. Choose speed (road via Alps) or economy (sea via Genoa).

faq.title: FAQ: Moving from Germany to Italy
faq.subtitle: Everything about moving via the Alps and to Italian islands

items.a: No. Both EU members. No customs, no duties. Only transport documents (CMR).

items.q: How long does the move take?
items.a: By road via Brenner — 3–5 days. Sea — 10–18 days. Air — 1–2 days. Islands add 1–3 days for ferry.

items.q: How do you handle Alpine passes?
items.a: Experienced mountain drivers. Anti-vibration loading. Brenner or Gotthard — we choose the optimal route based on weather and traffic.
Yes. Road through Italy + ferry via Villa San Giovanni. Or direct sea container to Palermo. 5–10 days total.
Road: from ~€300/m³. One-bedroom apartment (~10 m³) — from €3,000. Islands slightly more. Free quote.
Our teams are experienced with Italian buildings — no lifts, narrow spiral stairs, historic centres. External hoist available.

items.q: Can I ship wine from Germany?
items.a: Yes. Wine ships as personal belongings within EU. Temperature-controlled crates with vibration damping.
Zona a Traffico Limitato — restricted traffic zones in Italian historic centres. We handle permits for delivery day.

items.q: How do I track my shipment?
items.a: GPS throughout the Alpine route and beyond. Status updates at every stage. 24/7 WhatsApp.

items.q: Do you help with Italian registration?
items.a: We focus on logistics. For codice fiscale and residenza, we can recommend immigration advisors.
